meanings.definition: To fill or cover (a surface) with spackle.
meanings.sent1: I spackled the hole in the wall with spackle paste.
meanings.sent2: She always spackled the cracks in the ceiling before painting.
meanings.sent3: The clown spackled colorful spackle on his face for the circus.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter spackled the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The artist spackled the canvas with vibrant colors, creating a masterpiece.

meanings.sent1: The spackled wall looked smooth and flawless.
meanings.sent2: The spackled ceiling hid all imperfections beautifully.
meanings.sent3: The spackled cake was a delicious surprise at the party.
meanings.sent4: Her spackled notebook was filled with colorful doodles.
meanings.sent5: The spackled floor gleamed under the bright lights of the room.
